title: What are some examples of the Indian philosophical tradition? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many traditions - Vedanta, Mimamsa, Yoga, Bauddha, Arhata or Jaina, Sikh, Charvaka, Ramanuja, Purna-prajna, Nakulisa-Pasupata, Saiva, Pratyabhijna, Rasesvara, Vaiseshika, Akshapada or Nyaya, Jaiminiya, Paniniya, Sankhya etc. The basic classification is based on whether the tradition believes in the abstract concept of the ultimate reality, the “one truth” or not. One that does is categorized as an astika darshana, and one that doesn’t is known as the nastika darshana. Charvaka, Ajivika, Bauddha, Jaina etc are all Nastika darshana.
